description: From Bridewell (named after a well dedicated to St Bride), an area of London that once had a "house of correction".

entries.meaning: (dated in Britain, Ireland, rare elsewhere) A small prison, or a police station that has cells.
examples: 1983,  “The Wicklow Boy”, in  The Time Has Come‎[1], performed by Christy Moore:Others in the Bridewell heard him screaming. Even prison doctors could see. His injuries were not self-inflicted. Those who tipped the scales did not agree.
